revised_title: Isolation and Identification of Anthocyan Pigment in Red Roses
tldr: The authors isolated and identified the anthocyan pigment in red roses, specifically in the variety "George Dickson." They found that the pigment is the cyanidin glucoside, cyanin, present in about 9-10% of the dried petals. The study also suggests the presence of a yellow flavonol glucoside, possibly a quercetin glucoside, but further research is needed to confirm its identity.
